lead_paragraph: Bob Stackowitz of Sherman, Conn., used an alias after escaping from prison in 1968, but was recently discovered when he sought benefits under his real name. Even his longtime girlfriend was shocked.

byline.contributor: Kristin Hussey reported from Sherman, Lisa W. Foderaro from New York, and Alan Blinder from Carrollton, Ga.
byline.original: By KRISTIN HUSSEY, LISA W. FODERARO and ALAN BLINDER

headline.print_headline: Neighbor’s Secret Jolts a Connecticut Town: He Was a Fugitive for 48 Years
headline.main: A Small-Town Resident’s Secret for 48 Years: He Was a Fugitive

snippet: Bob Stackowitz of Sherman, Conn., used an alias after escaping from prison in 1968, but was recently discovered when he sought benefits under his real name. Even his longtime girlfriend was shocked.
abstract: Federal marshals arrest Bob Stackowitz in Sherman, Conn, 48 years after he escaped from Georgia prison where he had served two years of 17 year sentence for robbery; Sherman residents are divided over Stackowitz's fate, with some believing he would not survive jail due to health concerns, and others believe he should be held accountable for his crime.
